definition[0]: to feel very sad and to miss someone after they have died
example[0]: Hundreds of people gathered to mourn the slain president.
example[1]: She still mourns the death of her husband.
example[2]: They mourned for their children, killed in the war.
definition[1]: to feel very sad because something no longer exists or is no longer as good as it used to be
example[3]: The old steam trains were much loved, and we all mourn their passing.
